_comment: Created by EFisher on 25/02/2014 18:24:19 using v2.0
title: How has the proportion of older people living at home after discharge changed?
analysis_commentary: The proportion of older people who are still at home 91 days after discharge from hospital into reablement/rehabilitation services varied by 8.0% in 2012/13. The highest was 85.9% in London and the lowest was 77.9% in the East Midlands.
data_source: Health & Social Care Information Centre, Adult Social Care - Combined Activity Return (ASC-CAR)
